page.title: 18PUDSEY/DISHFORTH MOTORWAY
page.content: Motorways in Britain were first developed in the 1960s.The M1 was built from London northwards,linking it with Leeds.Industries in North-East England have since developed rapidly, requiring a motorway link with the South,avoiding the city of Leeds. In 1973, 2 proposed routes for a motorway,either east or west of Leeds were published.It was intended to help industries in W.Yorkshire and the industrial estates in S.E.Leeds.About 32000 vehicles per day were expected to use either route.The present A1 route would have reached its capacity by the 1980s and would need much improvement in any case. The Secretary of State,after touring the area,agreed on the route east of Leeds,based on the study of problems of the environment and estimated costs of Â£90000000 compared with Â£150000000.
